articles.title: Habagat to bring rain over most of PH; tropical cyclone remains outside PAR, PAGASA says
articles.description: The southwest monsoon or Habagat will bring cloudy skies with rain showers over Central and Southern Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao on Wednesday, PAGASA reported.
articles.content:
The southwest monsoon or Habagat will bring cloudy skies with rain showers over Central and Southern Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao on Wednesday, PAGASA reported.

articles.title: Emma Raducanu ‘locked in’ after straight-sets win at Queen’s Club
articles.description: Emma Raducanu began her grass-court singles campaign with a victory over Cristina Bucșa while Katie Boulter dug deep in her win against Ajla Tomljanovic
articles.content:
After a stream of winners and plenty of smiles, Emma Raducanu offered a succinct verdict on her first WTA singles match at Queen’s Club. “Very clean and clinical,” she said.
Indeed it was. Her Spanish opponent, Cristina Bucșa, is among the more stree... [4725 chars]

articles.title: Ministers pledge UK action to ratify high seas treaty by end of year
articles.description: Move comes after efforts at UN ocean summit to establish marine protected areas in international waters
articles.content:
Britain will take action to ratify the high seas treaty by the end of this year, a landmark agreement that will protect marine life in some of the oceans’ most remote waters, ministers have announced.
The move follows a surge in support and ratificat... [2642 chars]

articles.title: SpaceX readies private launch of four astronauts to International Space Station
articles.description: Four crew members are set to launch Wednesday on a privately funded mission to the International Space Station
articles.content:
Four crew members are set to launch Wednesday on a privately funded mission to the International Space Station.
The flight, organized by the Houston-based company Axiom Space, is slated to lift off at 8 a.m. ET from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Flo... [1978 chars]

articles.title: Undercover gardaí supplied Carlow gunman with firearms and ammunition, Oireachtas hears
articles.description: Garda Commissioner Drew Harris was questioned by politicians about Evan Fitzgerald’s case
articles.content:
Gardaí said Evan Fitzgerald (22), from Kiltegan, Co Wicklow, stole a weapon from a neighbour and walked through Fairgreen Shopping Centre in Carlow, firing a shotgun into the air

articles.title: Calls for weight-loss drugs like Ozempic to be subsidised for people with schizophrenia
articles.description: Researchers say people with schizophrenia are facing an "epidemic" of obesity-related diseases, with weight gain a common side effect of antipsychotic drugs.
articles.content:
Queensland researchers are calling for weight-loss medicines to be listed on the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (PBS) for people with schizophrenia, after a trial found they didn't affect psychotic symptoms.
The team at University of Queensland said ... [6348 chars]

articles.title: Erin Phillips's Australian Football Hall of Fame speech leaves dad in tears, as Daisy Pearce also inducted
articles.description: Erin Phillips and Daisy Pearce become the first AFLW players to be inducted into the Australian Football Hall of Fame.
articles.content:
Erin Phillips paid an emotional tribute to her father, Greg, as she joined him in the Australian Football Hall Of Fame.
Phillips and Daisy Pearce became the first AFLW players to be inducted, joining trailblazer Debbie Lee as female inductees.

articles.title: LA immigration violence: Troops to stay in area for 60 days as Trump stays firm on protest response
articles.description: Donald Trump says the National Guard will leave Los Angeles "when there's no danger". Follow live.
articles.content:
In the Oval Office, Donald Trump told reporters LA was now in "great shape" after his decision to deploy the National Guard.
"By doing what I did, I stopped the the violence in LA," he said.

articles.title: Dorinda Cox accuses Greens of racism in scathing resignation letter
articles.description: In a fiery resignation letter, ex-Greens senator Dorinda Cox accuses her former party of racism and ignoring serious claims she raised.
articles.content:
In a fiery resignation letter, ex-Greens senator Dorinda Cox has accused her former party of racism and ignoring serious claims she raised, including disputed allegations of an assault at Perth Airport by a party member.

articles.title: Socceroos qualify for 2026 World Cup with victory over Saudi Arabia
articles.description: The Socceroos need to avoid a five-goal loss to Saudi Arabia this morning to qualify for the 2026 World Cup. Follow all the action.
articles.content:
The Socceroos have clinched a sixth successive World Cup appearance, passing their final test in qualifying with flying colours as they secured a stirring and historic 2-1 victory over Saudi Arabia in Jeddah.
